TaxonIdentification.variety_authority: (Greene) G. K. Brown & D. J. Keil

treatment.description: Plants 10–30 cm. Stems probably slender (leafy). Leaves: basal blades lanceolate or narrowly spatulate, 80–120 × 10–18 mm (margins conspicuously spinulose-serrate). Involucres narrowly campanulate, 17 × 20–25 mm. Phyllaries lanceolate to oblong, apices broad, truncate, abruptly mucronate, mucro recurved.
treatment.discussion: Variety subsquarrosa is known from about 22 locations in northwestern Wyoming and adjacent southwestern Montana. This taxon is recognized by its low stature and phyllaries with recurved apices.
